gpt-message.content: You are an expert in hardware design with a deep understanding of Verilog RTL codes. Now I want to train a large language model for code comment generation tasks specifically focused on Verilog RTL codes. And I want you to help me process the raw data, transforming it into suitable formats that can serve as inputs and outputs for the model.

Name of the module and its functionality is as follows: 
Module name: example_top

Explanation: This module appears to be a top-level design for a DDR3 memory controller interface. It instantiates a memory controller wrapper (memc3_wrapper_inst) and a test bench top module (memc3_tb_top_inst). The design includes configuration parameters for the memory interface, such as data width, address width, and timing parameters. It also defines multiple ports (p0 to p5) for memory read and write operations. The module integrates clock generation, reset logic, and calibration functionalities for the DDR3 interface. Overall, it serves as a comprehensive example of how to implement and test a DDR3 memory controller in an FPGA design.

Input and output ports and their explanation is as follows: 
Input ports:
c3_sys_clk, c3_sys_rst_i

Explanation:
c3_sys_clk: System clock input
c3_sys_rst_i: System reset input (active high)

Output ports:
calib_done, error, mcb3_dram_a, mcb3_dram_ba, mcb3_dram_ras_n, mcb3_dram_cas_n, mcb3_dram_we_n, mcb3_dram_odt, mcb3_dram_reset_n, mcb3_dram_cke, mcb3_dram_dm, mcb3_dram_udm, mcb3_dram_ck, mcb3_dram_ck_n

Explanation:
calib_done: Calibration done signal
error: Error signal
mcb3_dram_*: Various DDR3 SDRAM interface signals (address, bank address, control signals, data mask, clock)

Inout ports:
mcb3_dram_dq, mcb3_dram_udqs, mcb3_dram_udqs_n, mcb3_rzq, mcb3_dram_dqs, mcb3_dram_dqs_n

Explanation:
mcb3_dram_dq: Bidirectional data bus for DDR3 SDRAM
mcb3_dram_*dqs*: Data strobe signals for DDR3 SDRAM
mcb3_rzq: ZQ calibration pin for DDR3 SDRAM

This module has a mix of input, output, and inout ports to interface with DDR3 SDRAM and provide control and status signals for the memory controller system.

Internal signals and their explanation is as follows: 
Based on the given code and previous answers, here are the internal signals and their explanations:

Internal signals: c3_sys_clk_p, c3_sys_clk_n, c3_error, c3_calib_done, c3_clk0, c3_rst0, c3_async_rst, c3_sysclk_2x, c3_sysclk_2x_180, c3_pll_ce_0, c3_pll_ce_90, c3_pll_lock, c3_mcb_drp_clk, c3_cmp_error, c3_cmp_data_valid, c3_vio_modify_enable, c3_vio_data_mode_value, c3_vio_addr_mode_value, c3_cmp_data, c3_p0_cmd_en, c3_p0_cmd_instr, c3_p0_cmd_bl, c3_p0_cmd_byte_addr, c3_p0_cmd_empty, c3_p0_cmd_full.

Explanation:
c3_sys_clk_p, c3_sys_clk_n: Differential system clock signals
c3_error: Error signal from the memory controller
c3_calib_done: Calibration done signal from the memory controller
c3_clk0, c3_rst0: Main clock and reset signals
c3_async_rst: Asynchronous reset signal
c3_sysclk_2x, c3_sysclk_2x_180: 2x system clock and its 180-degree phase-shifted version
c3_pll_ce_0, c3_pll_ce_90: PLL clock enable signals (0 and 90 degrees)
c3_pll_lock: PLL lock signal
c3_mcb_drp_clk: Memory controller DRP (Dynamic Reconfiguration Port) clock
c3_cmp_error, c3_cmp_data_valid: Comparison error and data valid signals
c3_vio_modify_enable: VIO (Virtual Input/Output) modify enable signal
c3_vio_data_mode_value, c3_vio_addr_mode_value: VIO data and address mode values
c3_cmp_data: Comparison data signal
c3_p0_cmd_en, c3_p0_cmd_instr, c3_p0_cmd_bl, c3_p0_cmd_byte_addr: Port 0 command signals (enable, instruction, burst length, byte address)
c3_p0_cmd_empty, c3_p0_cmd_full: Port 0 command FIFO status signals

These internal signals are used for clock management, reset control, memory controller status, and command interface for the DDR3 SDRAM controller.
